newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwe ex-president faces sex offence charges - police.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwe ex-president faces sex offence charges - police.

text.p: Zimbabwean police said they would on Friday hand over to the attorney general a docket of at least nine allegations of sexual offences said to have been committed by former president Canaan Banana.

Confirming a report by the official Herald newspaper that Banana faced at least nine charges of sodomy and homosexuality, both illegal in Zimbabwe, police spokesman Mario Dube told Reuters: "The docket should be at the attorney general's office sometime today".
He declined further comment on the issue.
The Herald quoted acting police commissioner Philip Mhike as saying the nine allegations came from information volunteered by the people affected. Mhike was unavailable for further comment.
Police have been investigating Banana, 61, -- who was largely ceremonial president for seven years up to 1987 -- since February after an ex-police aide alleged in court that Banana had raped him.
The former aide, Jefta Dube, was sentenced in February to 10 years in jail for the 1995 fatal shooting of a fellow policeman who goaded him by calling him "Banana's wife".
Dube told the court then that his homosexual subjugation by Banana had made him depressive and an alcoholic, and judge David Bartlett ruled that Dube had diminished responsibility.
